 The <TT>trigger</TT> argument defines in which case a build on the next node should be triggered, must be one of
 <TT>'allCases'</TT>, <TT>'success'</TT> or <TT>'unstable'</TT>.

 The <TT>eligibility</TT> argument defines how selected offline nodes should be handled, must be one of
 <TT>'AllNodeEligibility'</TT>, <TT>'IgnoreOfflineNodeEligibility'</TT> or
 <TT>'IgnoreTempOfflineNodeEligibility'</TT>.
signatures.firstSentenceCommentText: Defines in which case a build on the next node should be triggered.

signatures.html:
Adds links in the sidebar of the project page.

 The icon may be a plain filename of an image in Jenkins' <TT>images/24x24</TT> directory (such as
 <TT>help.gif</TT>, <TT>document.gif</TT> or <TT>refresh.gif</TT>), or <TT>/userContent/filename.ext</TT> for a custom
 icon placed in the <TT>JENKINS_HOME/userContent</TT> directory. User content can also be uploaded by using
 javaposse.jobdsl.dsl.DslFactory#userContent(java.lang.String, java.io.InputStream).
signatures.firstSentenceCommentText: Adds links in the sidebar of the project page.

signatures.html:
Sets the thresholds for considering a build as unstable or failed.

 The parameter is a mapping from build status to a mapping from priority to threshold. The keys of the outer map
 must be one or more of <TT>'unstableTotal'</TT>, <TT>'failedTotal'</TT>, <TT>'unstableNew'</TT> and
 <TT>'failedNew'</TT>. The keys of the inner map must be one or more of <TT>'all'</TT>, <TT>'low'</TT>,
 <TT>'normal'</TT> and <TT>'high'</TT>.

signatures.html: If set to true, Jenkins will parse the POMs of this project, and see if any of its snapshot dependencies are built on this Jenkins as well. Defaults to false.

signatures.html:
Specify the number of successful release builds to keep forever. A value of -1 will lock all successful
 release builds, 0 will not lock any builds. Defaults to 1.
signatures.firstSentenceCommentText: Specify the number of successful release builds to keep forever.

signatures.html:
An environment variable with this name indicates whether the current build is a release build or not.
 This can be used e.g. within a shell or the conditional buildstep to do pre and post release processing.
 The value will be boolean (true if it is a release build, false if its not a release build). Defaults to
 <TT>'IS_M2RELEASEBUILD'</TT>.
signatures.firstSentenceCommentText: An environment variable with this name indicates whether the current build is a release build or not.

signatures.html:
Enter the goals you wish to use as part of the release process. Defaults to
 <TT>'-Dresume=false release:prepare release:perform'</TT>.
signatures.firstSentenceCommentText: Enter the goals you wish to use as part of the release process.

signatures.html: If defined, an environment variable with this name will hold the scm password when triggering a release build (this is the password the user enters when triggering a release build, not the password given to Jenkins' SCM configuration of the job). Empty by default. As the passed passwords would potentially get written to the logs and therefore visible to users, it is recommended to install the Mask Password Plugin.
signatures.firstSentenceCommentText:
If defined, an environment variable with this name will hold the scm password when triggering a

 given to Jenkins' SCM configuration of the job).

methods.name: deliveryPipelineView

signatures.html: Creates or updates a view that renders pipelines based on upstream/downstream jobs.
signatures.firstSentenceCommentText: Creates or updates a view that renders pipelines based on upstream/downstream jobs.

signatures.html: Creates or updates a view that renders pipelines based on upstream/downstream jobs.
signatures.firstSentenceCommentText: Creates or updates a view that renders pipelines based on upstream/downstream jobs.

methods.examples:
deliveryPipelineView('project-a') {
    pipelineInstances(5)
    showAggregatedPipeline()
    columns(2)
    sorting(Sorting.TITLE)
    updateInterval(60)
    enableManualTriggers()
    showAvatars()
    showChangeLog()
    pipelines {
        component('Sub System A', 'compile-a')
        component('Sub System B', 'compile-b')
        regex(/compile-subsystem-(.*)/)
    }
}

signatures.firstSentenceCommentText: Streams a file from the workspace of the seed job.

methods.name: userContent

signatures.html: Upload the stream as user content. Use DslFactory.streamFileFromWorkspace to read the content from a file.
signatures.firstSentenceCommentText: Upload the stream as user content.

methods.examples:
// save the file images/logo.png from the seed job's workspace as user content
userContent('company-logo.png', streamFileFromWorkspace('images/logo.png'))
